E204E3DBCFA0464BB2B6D18D3C2CABC7.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

4A3A2C2FADB6435F95ECADF63C46A233.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

022A3369B6AB4DF8B38FE3B6D9BF787C.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume and portfolio) following the work placement

C9052665267B4B7CBE29797E411BC713.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

403356EEAECE44328F25AA2812918671.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship and partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry

0DBED4225B8D4A40B706DADD62F250FD.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

083BB226ADE54103A26C18891F97D9A2.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

23148887DCFA42F38DC407BFC27E6FF0.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets and reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

588E441C53974CDBBBDD524756D7DBE4.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

2F2BF270CAC34E27B49C16C66877D7CB.description: Participate in a work placement experience

BA5A0D6CF15B4CAAB39E894BC48CA479.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

EF076F0E33964C5BA736778E18D29B3F.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

A1330C0A5E6E434AA3F5FA61F49BE6DD.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions

6F46F834CC384AF2A1C26D60D7107370.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

5F0C9EA47EB64FA391D6255FB89B4231.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms)

C056BC050AC0407E81543AD5A7BD1682.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

E46B614CA23B4231B47153062F05DEAA.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

21F6EA3E973B4DB6BE4F3943AB1D5D7A.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

DCC8C627E21A4B4480941331B1938826.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff and employer) involved in the work placement.

8C9275848AF24E92BB8A9247DAA944A6.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

7C8DAC5CAE63489A8B646BB4CB199DC6.description: Reflect on business and personal successes and challenges resulting from the operation of the start-up.

E7D26A6DBCBE4AF5A0A6BB874767A5C8.description: Present the final written report to others such as supporters and investors.

C6FD0EC02D824B0B92D65A4BC1B8A76C.description: Prepare a final written report (e.g., shareholders’ report) that summarizes operations and success.

D3ECE658512A485A8C8FDE67557D3046.description: Conclude operations which may include activities such as: liquidating assets; paying outstanding debts; collecting any receivables; and paying shareholders

526496B2E8CD4331A30025513CB447E4.description: Maintain detailed records (e.g., financial and inventory) throughout the life of the business.

9C3C92CDB428484E97B9A3D3B3D28B98.description: Adjust business operations and the business plan as required throughout the life of the business.

E918C81E46F14479A9C91B2E2EB62733.description: Explain what a pivot is and why a pivot strategy is important for business success

696601DAF0844B609D8FD9D87AC83B1C.description: Reflect regularly on business progress and success by answering questions such as: What has worked well thus far? .Are sales goals being met?, Do we have enough supplies to meet production demands? ,What needs adjustment and why?, How can productivity be improved?, What has been accomplished in the business to date?, Where is the business at financially? Is there a cash-flow problem?, What have I personally contributed? How else can I contribute? • What have I learned about business and what it takes to successfully operate a business?, What have I learned about myself?

577BC9C56B9D4669B7EB28BB00482D6D.description: Discuss the need for revisiting, updating and revising a business plan throughout the life of a business

463A956468D944FDA00B639AF73CC9D1.description: Execute, conclude, evaluate the success of, and report on, the start-up.

B0EC6329084B4DCC9F921674E97F15C7.description: Executing and Concluding a Start-up B (Optional)

3BCC372E5594467599CF7CB38AF17FF9.description: Make required adjustments to the business plan.

4F923CF46A0147AB915E54717397B036.description: Reflect on feedback received from potential investors or supporters.

B068A6E75FED48BB835563541470024A.description: Present the business plan to potential investors or supporters.

82F8AC0F2CDE410D8E68653D625874F2.description: Develop a written business plan for a proposed start-up

9D60F82085704091996539702AA31339.description: Examine characteristics (e.g., written in plain, easy-to-understand language; research-based; well-defined market; and, realistic) of an effective and well-written business plan.

34F45473A71E4522833A4C992604175A.description: Analyze prepared business plans to identify and describe common components (e.g., executive summary, company description, market analysis, financial projections, operational plan, succession plan and conclusion) of a business plan.

17C7DBDFB41F49D6B31D3B306F273BC1.description: Discuss reasons (e.g., obtaining financing and planning a start-up or expansion) for preparing a written business plan.

525D9DA32B674AFE8FFDB6F911A15FC9.description: Differentiate between a business model canvas and a business plan.

7163D42B3EF2498883939CC2FE773E6A.description: Construct a detailed business plan for a proposed start-up.

64BE4F9CA9B2400F9F0CD6433ADDEE1E.description: Construct a personal plan or a plan for another individual aspiring to be an entrepreneur, considering factors such as a supportive network of allies; membership in, and support from, professional organizations and associations; and, education, training and learning opportunities.

D83D9590BD1F4896B6105DD82B76F64D.description: Reflect on personal interest in, and suitability for, entrepreneurship as a career pathway of choice.

CDB340F006A94D2AB2B3800977BF5499.description: Debate the idea that being an entrepreneur is better than working for someone else.

3EC4190A855F46AAB8946C7448B148B7.description: Discuss reasons (e.g., media showcasing successful entrepreneurs and increased attention to social entrepreneurship) why entrepreneurship is becoming more widely accepted as a viable career pathway.

ACF9236344AE420DB2598A9E420913CA.description: Research typical earnings for entrepreneurs in Saskatchewan and Canada.

E8FF2E04712D4FD9A40CFC84D03DD9A9.description: Critique common misconceptions about entrepreneurs, such as: Entrepreneurs can be successful only if they have access to lots of money. Entrepreneurs set their own hours and vacation schedules. Entrepreneurs work alone. Entrepreneurs take huge risks to be successful. Entrepreneurs are wealthy. All it takes is one good idea to be a successful entrepreneur. Every entrepreneur needs a post-secondary business degree to be successful.

A47A3E029BA74EB58A69FE292B52F508.description: Explore entrepreneurship as a career pathway.

1A1A0C55BADC484F8895F8F107FB2C90.description: Reflect on ways that an employer/management can support a healthy and safe work environment, such as: leading by example; establishing, and training employees on, procedures for identifying hazards and mitigating associated risks; holding supervisors and workers accountable; and, setting reasonable health and safety goals and objectives.

C930E70C0D2A45C68DA336311A364327.description: Investigate employers’ and employees’ rights and responsibilities as they pertain to health and safety in the workplace in Saskatchewan.

2656F9239BC64FF79CABD3B56CF56EBC.description: Role-play situations where employees, supervisors and managers effectively deal with health and safety concerns within the workplace.

57130833F35D47CD9A49953D427DBC21.description: Research: the meaning of due diligence and an employer’s responsibility to protect the health and safety of all workers; the legal requirements for health and safety programs in the workplace outlined in provincial legislation (e.g., Occupational Health and Safety Regulations); the legal requirement for, and purpose of, an occupational health and safety (OHS) committee within the workplace; and the financial penalties for failing to comply with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulations

7EF2DB5C19E04280BC1591779150F1A4.description: Discuss reasons (e.g., protecting the health and safety of employees, creating a positive work environment and the costs [e.g., to the injured worker and to the business] associated with a workplace injury or incident) for having a safety plan within a business.

FF2D91DEDD444B1C92818FF9FDE1D1CE.description: Identify the benefits to employers and employees of the Saskatchewan Workers Compensation Act and the Meredith Principles.

A8DD4DA07C9245D08E4BDF879DE017F7.description: Describe the general duties of self-employed persons as outlined in the Saskatchewan Employment Act.

8569751C204B4E86A179940E98125717.description: Assess the importance of an occupational health and safety plan within a business.

C192931B22F44984949C3922586E6B58.description: Identify credible sources of mental health support for Saskatchewan and Canadian entrepreneurs.

D3CDFCE7C81E4C19A77F8E4D4739712C.description: Explore the impact of mentoring relationships on mental health and wellbeing.

EE46D3C4664148DEB7D548F892C95479.description: Suggest strategies (e.g., practising self-care and surrounding oneself with positive influences) for addressing and maintaining positive mental health as an entrepreneur.

9F38262EEEFC44608089C4C2C9B6002E.description: Investigate barriers (e.g., cost and stigma) faced by entrepreneurs in seeking mental health services and support.

FC21F7E18A1344C78FC57883EEB821EA.description: Analyze differences in the mental health and well-being challenges faced by various groups of entrepreneurs such as women, newcomers, younger entrepreneurs and individuals who are gender and/or sexually diverse.

4FB09384E9D347F8B62D0A60B286F999.description: Research statistics related to the mental health and well-being of Canadian entrepreneurs

0E7CC386EBF840EEB1D619B8B0CE0927.description: Identify stressors (e.g., income uncertainty, loneliness and isolation) faced by many entrepreneurs and the resulting impact on self, the business, society and others such as family and friends

1323BF9C9BF645F199D5C558A3B93997.description: Analyze the relationship between an entrepreneur’s personal mental health and well-being and the health of their business.

D3832DA23A594F4E807307EE2A3D6B73.description: Discuss the concept of life/work balance as it relates to entrepreneurs.

73EC5D887B784129A1F1F8D0FFBF2318.description: Assess the importance of positive mental health and well-being for Saskatchewan and Canadian entrepreneurs.

2068464BA065474DBC92D5856A9E1357.description: Develop a financial plan for a business that includes components such as: an income statement; a cash flow statement; a balance sheet; a sales forecast; and, a break-even analysis.

E912F520D6C34242AC5E4F947BBC5FA0.description: Analyze the conditions of businesses represented by their respective financial statements.

91D15DB3A59A499ABF09ACE8B0982A2B.description: Prepare balance sheets and income statements for personal use or for given individual and for business scenarios.

83E9B8ECFC004945BE35BD3928F6832C.description: Analyze prepared balance sheets and income statements to determine how financial statements are used within the context of a business.

AD4FE21B15304BEAAA520761A12BB7CC.description: Examine formats for basic financial recordkeeping (e.g., using software such as spreadsheets or accounting packages and paper copy).

9DE1D1C9444D487FA585B475E56DE416.description: Analyze components of a sound financial plan for business.

0E3453AB60B8404FA3BED6E9C7DE0121.description: Financial Records, Planning and Management B (Core)

612E6A1EC97F465A99369E2091911C37.description: Propose effective employee retention strategies (e.g., training, bonuses and benefits).

386D01A8A7014E9FA24211D6B1D1EDCE.description: Discuss the relationship among employee satisfaction with their jobs, business success and a business’ reputation.

B417DE7FF7204AF2B1DE209F8D8653E6.description: Assess Saskatchewan and Canadian laws that govern workplace standards pertaining, but not limited, to workplace safety, anti-discrimination, harassment, accessibility and environmental responsibility.

858250C665C44400B07755A43894219E.description: Conduct an inquiry into the processes commonly used by employers to attract, screen and hire employees.

3F95B8029AAB4E9F9F86DCC44D690FA9.description: Identify sources (e.g., referrals from friends and employees, hiring from within, employment agencies and social media platforms) for recruiting potential employees

BD6577B43FD04CE18A8604999CEB726B.description: Strategize ways to effectively manage generational and cultural gaps within the workplace.

45592D6A522846979E3ED9791724C753.description: Research the potential impact of generational and cultural gaps within Saskatchewan workplaces.

858159EE423B45F88D6C4B27447CEEED.description: Research factors (e.g., the number of employees required currently and in the next few years, training that will be provided, job requirements/descriptions, and how and how much employees will be paid) to be considered in a human resources plan.

994CB03D108D442E9CF37F66F5BB126A.description: Explain the function and importance of human resource management within a business

48DB089E51FE41AF89F83EE70249BCC9.description: Explore the role of human resource management within a business.

9460FBA52BBF4AE8B4E5D8063E6ECD7E.description: Discuss potential positive and negative impacts of factors such as changes in currency values, tariffs, laws/regulations, political unrest, natural disasters and global pandemics on global trade/exports and efforts of individual entrepreneurs to reach global markets.

D15762B0B27E4F25A0C2DA96C2C9B475.description: Research the support and services provided by organizations such as STEP.

3448B2C890AE498EBB912E1BA1A5B6D8.description: Identify organizations (e.g., Saskatchewan Trade and Export Partnership [STEP]) that assist Saskatchewan entrepreneurs in accessing global markets.

69EE6C2B48094DC3BC0787056F9DED69.description: Investigate strategies including e-commerce for reaching potential customers beyond the local area.

06136353384046B68DAA75EE85FF051E.description: Analyze statistics and trends related to the evolution of electronic commerce (i.e., e-commerce).

1D8C9E91CCB74F40B5D05F78C2DE59B1.description: Propose instances when entrepreneurs might choose to market their goods or services to potential customers provincially, nationally and globally.

06F586ED9F2D459FB25E489719B9D926.description: Identify local marketplaces and selling opportunities/services (e.g., trade shows, local farmers’ market, community bulletin boards, buy/sell groups and social media platforms).

6CBE462A741944569098A878444387DD.description: Discuss the importance to Saskatchewan of trading, exporting and selling beyond its provincial borders.

6E927B9E9684491ABD1C012DB2B67158.description: Identify major international customers of Saskatchewan products.

37C5044914E84321AE6678D92DBED419.description: Research Saskatchewan’s major export goods (e.g., agriculture, agri-food, oil and potash) and services (e.g., technology) as well as niche markets filled by unique Saskatchewan goods and services.

2676501040E3405ABA726E2F11D01FFE.description: Describe the uniqueness of the local area and the businesses, including the goods and services they provide, operating within it.

7E7E65ADF778454B9FB7DAF290285255.description: Evaluate opportunities for marketing to local, Saskatchewan, Canadian and global communities.

10C1F3CFC98542A28282606F63D12EAD.description: The Local, Saskatchewan, Canadian and Global Marketplace (Core)

D048DF04210E4AB096138498D6C3D075.description: Reflect on personal interests, hobbies and skills that could potentially lead to the development of a home-based business.

74BF6E1C57C848C59690D4F55686BA3F.description: Identify direct sales companies (e.g., skin care, health and wellness, home cleaning products and make-up) that may represent potential home-based business opportunities.

D20D0425B0714EF19FF1D6BB3C0B0DDE.description: Outline the steps for establishing a home-based business within the community.

3E1F62365DD94BDC9BF5FF2D2D19B104.description: Research factors (e.g., zoning, liability, legal and insurance) that should be considered when establishing a home-based business.

9D5E4F9BBC1F4F00865120E6A36AF00F.description: Examine the advantages (e.g., tax deductions, low overhead and location) and disadvantages (e.g., limited space in the home, issues with neighbours and difficulty separating work from family life) of operating a home-based business.

29ED40177DFC4D0BB9CA5C18DBFFEB44.description: Research the prevalence and types of home-based businesses within the community

B4499368F4E54595936555C66C520A66.description: Discuss reasons why individuals start home-based businesses

4A8A42BDC05E408792B225EFB744502A.description: Analyze the steps for starting a home-based business within the community.

0FB20279CD0749F0A834F89F73BC879F.description: Reflect on personal and collective responsibility for supporting Indigenous economic reconciliation within the local and broader community.

D494E77DFB6B472DA6CB11670535F87F.description: Assess the economic, social and cultural opportunities provided by the establishment of urban reserves in Saskatchewan.

3DE2F8846C3443D9A18B71C51AE9FA03.description: Research the history of urban reserves in Saskatchewan including the impact of the Saskatchewan Treaty Land Entitlement Framework Agreement.

13844E1A92204405929D745C1950F419.description: Identify urban reserves located in Saskatchewan.

C77A2710465E4E4399BA919D42C90C2A.description: Investigate opportunities (e.g., innovation, creating wealth and community issues/problems) that could be addressed by entrepreneurship within the local and/or provincial community.

0A9CBBD46B764FC0A81FD6FE320D9725.description: Describe the concept of economic leakage and the resulting impact on remote, rural, urban and First Nations communities

479612C2449B48BA9ED80600CAD81182.description: Discuss the benefits of Indigenous economic reconciliation for all peoples in Canada

A3B1B1B1BD7F46088F748191A12E3678.description: Investigate the tenets of Indigenous economic reconciliation including its holistic, values-driven approach to attaining community economic prosperity.

15BD430488CF4A84955DEB699F61279D.description: Research challenges faced, and contributions made, by First Nations and Métis peoples in helping to shape the entrepreneurial landscape of Saskatchewan and Canada.

8120021502BE42D88212290FD578ED3C.description: Describe the state of entrepreneurship among First Nations peoples in Saskatchewan and Canada pre- and post-colonization

07BE8635232F422E8757FF84C67C0731.description: Investigate Indigenous economic reconciliation as an important contributor to reconciliation in Canada.
